content: final stitch count from your left to your right circular needle tip slip 11% of your stitches from your final stitch count to a second double point needle and 11% to a third double point needle slide 26% of your stitches from your final stitch count from the left to the right circular needle tip slip the last 11% of your stitches onto a fourth double point needle for example let s say your final stitch count was 92 stitches you will have 11 stitches on each of four double point needles and 24 stitches on each side of your circular needle if your numbers don t work out perfectly and you have a few left over these are easily hidden on the double pointed needles you can knit 2 together there if needed- they won t show because they are on the inside of the hat you may wish to reposition your needles so the most interesting section of your color pooling is on the circular needles this will become the most visible part at the top of your hat finishing to set up knit across dp needle #1 using a three needle bind-off and holding the right sides of your knitting together bind off the stitches on your first and fourth double point needles do not cut yarn still using a three needle bind-off and holding the right sides of your knitting together bind off the stitches on your second and third double point needles together cut yarn holding the tips of your circular needle parallel and with the wrong sides of your knitting together kitchener stitch the top of the hat closed be sure to use a section of yarn on your darning needle that matches the pooled colors at the top of your hat weave in ends top of hat divided onto double points finished top of hat wrong side out kitchenered top of hat right side out
